column4: what is the equivalent of the "device manager" in windows to ubuntu?
touchpad is a known regression
especially middle button and scrolling. You'll probably have to wait for the fix
u mean, it's knownnot to work?
regression = it used to work in previous distro, but it doesn't anymore. So yeah.
do u think regenerating the xorg.config might help?
I doubt that but it probably can't harm :)
I don't think there's any
thx.  will try 2 regenerate.  any other ideas btw?
there isn't much to really manage about devices in ubuntu, usually they just work or they don't :P
what you configure then are the applications that use them
is there anyway 2 revert to 9.04?
I don't think so
it worked!!!! regenerating (even though it didn't show any dialogs) got my mousepad 2 work!!!
middle button works?
my touchpad doesn't have a middle button
but if i plug in my external mouse, the middle button works -- not sure if that makes ne diff

well if you install xsynaptic (touchpad setting), or even in the normal mouse settings, you can set middle button emulation. Like 2 fingers at once or left+right button at once, or something. And that's what doesn't work for many people :)
i thought xsynaptic became obsolete w/ ubuntu?
yeah well with it or without it, it doesnt work :)
lol.  gotcha.  anyway, thx 4 ur help.
